metadata.synopsis: King Henry VIII has died, and his only heir, a young Edward VI (Warren Saire), is dying too. Minister John Dudley (John Wood) doesn't want the Roman Catholic Princess Mary (Jane Lapotaire) to become queen, as that would end the Protestant Reformation. Dudley plots to keep Edward alive long enough to name Lady Jane Grey (Helena Bonham Carter) as his heir and also marries Jane to his son, Guilford (Cary Elwes). Jane and Guilford soon fall in love, but the kingdom doesn't believe they should rule.

reviews: The movie is well-made and has excellent performances. [Full Review in Spanish]
Overall, the movie is cloddishly composed, with awkward zooms and theatrical blocking.
About the short life of an English scholar, reformer, and religious martyr.
